content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:2021 Halloween event
2021 Halloween event
Released 20 October 2021 (Update)
End date 3 November 2021 (Update)
Reward See below
Preceded by 2020 Halloween event
Succeeded by N/A

The 2021 Halloween event is the Halloween holiday event taking place from 20 October until 3 November.

To begin, head to Varrock Square in the centre of Varrock. The holiday event icon displays the location of the event on the world map and minimap.

Contents

  • 1 Walkthrough
  • 2 Rewards
  • 3 Transcript
  • 4 Changes
  • 5 Trivia
    • 5.1 Bugs
  • 6 Notes

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Speak to the protesting monks in Varrock Square. They will ask you to go to the Edgeville Monastery and talk to Brother Jered as Oziach is trying to buy the whole monastery from them. After talking to Brother Jered on the ground floor[UK]1st floor[US] a cutscene will ensue with the player attempting to spook Oziach by making a scary noise with Jered's empty wine bottle, while hiding inside a tree. Finish the dialogue and quickly climb into the tree. Return to Brother Jered and speak to him once more. He gives you an ad coupon to put an ad in the Varrock Herald to find a ghost accomplice.

One ghost was not enough!

Talk to Benny in Varrock Square about the Halloween event and offer any of the three options.

Death appears in the Blue Moon Inn, interested in the advertised job.

Go to the Blue Moon Inn to see if anyone responded to your advert. Talk to Iffie. A cutscene will follow afterwards with the player telling Iffie what to do for the job, with Death himself intervening and telling the player that he also wants the job. The player selects Iffie as their accomplice at the end. Talk to Iffie once more, then talk to the bartender and select the pie option. In the next cutscene select any pie insult to distract the cook so Iffie can steal some of the kitchen's utensils.

Head south of the monastery, where you will find Iffie. Speak to her to enter a cutscene where you and her chase Oziach away by climbing trees and acting like ghosts. You must climb the three trees with a 'climb' option without being spotted by Oziach, or the cutscene will restart.

Speak to Iffie after the cutscene, after answering yes to provide her with her reward, you return to the Blue Moon Inn in Varrock for another cutscene. Once it completes, finish the dialogue to finish the event.

Congratulations, event complete!

Rewards[edit | edit source]

Partying in the Blue Moon Inn.
  • Haunted wine bottle
  • Saucepan
  • Ugly halloween jumper
  • Two noted pumpkins
  • Two noted Halloween mask sets
  • Rewards from previous events, which can be claimed from Diango.
  • Spooky, Dead Can Dance and Illusive music tracks are unlocked in the cutscenes, without requiring the player to go to their usual unlock locations.

Transcript[edit | edit source]

This article on an event has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations encountered throughout the event.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
20-30 October 2021

Two typos were fixed in Oziach's overhead dialogue in a cutscene.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • There are numerous references to previously released quests throughout the event, including (but not limited to) Recipe for Disaster and Monk's Friend. Completing certain quests will give the player new options to insult the cook's pumpkin pie that the player can reference.
    • Freeing King Awowogei in Recipe for Disaster: "Urgh, I'd rather eat a stuffed snake with Awowogei than this!"
    • The Lost Tribe: "Blerg, I think I'd rather eat some H.A.M. robes than this!"
    • Cook's Assistant: "I may only be a cooks assistant, but this food is terrible!"
    • Other options: "Yuck, even a stray dog wouldn't eat this!", "This tastes eww, urgh, blerg, yuck!"
  • The music tracks Getting Down to Business and Illusive play during cutscenes in the event, allowing free-to-play players to unlock these previously members-only tracks. This also allows Illusive to be unlocked without completing Dream Mentor.
  • During the event, after you recruited Iffie, an empty rocking chair is shown in the shop, still rocking. Examining it reveals the text "Where did Iffie go? And who is rocking the chair?!?"
  • If players attempt to use any items on the climbable evergreen tree, the chatbox will state I don't want to do that to this tree! This includes raw herrings and cooked herrings.
  • The LFG advert is a reference to an acronym used by players of multiplayer games looking for a group.

Bugs[edit | edit source]

Bug:
In the cinematic action scene south of the Edgeville Monastery where the player and Iffie both desire to climb the trees to scare Oziach, if the player attempts to climb the evergreen trees on Iffie's side or too far down the path, Oziach cannot spot the player anymore. Leaving the instance or climbing the next correct tree resolves this.
Bugs:
Once Iffie has returned to Thessalia's Fine Clothes. store, if Iffie attempted to give the player their rewards but the player didn't have enough free inventory space, and the player then chooses to say they're not ready for the rewards, Iffie's dialogue abruptly continues to her being busy knitting:[note 1]
  • Iffie: Hello [player name]! Are you ready for your rewards now?
    • Yes!
      • Dialogue
      • (End of dialogue)
    • Not yet.
      • Player: Not yet.
      • Iffie: Come back when you are, I have something for you!
      • (Continues below)[sic]
  • Iffie: Sorry, dearie, if I stop to chat I'll lose count.
  • (End of dialogue)

Notes[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Before the player's had a chat with Iffie first, her dialogue ends as intended:
    • Not yet.
      • Player: Not yet.
      • Iffie: Come back when you are, I have something for you!
      • (End of dialogue)
    After the player has claimed the rewards, she no longer talks about the Halloween event as intended, reverting back to her one-liner non-event dialogue:
    • Iffie: Sorry, dearie, if I stop to chat I'll lose count.
    • (End of dialogue)

The '''2021 Halloween event''' is the Halloween holiday event taking place from [[20 October]] until [[3 November]].

To begin, head to [[Varrock Square]] in the centre of [[Varrock]]. The holiday event [[icon]] [[File:Holiday event icon.png]] displays the location of the event on the [[world map]] and [[minimap]].
{{Clear|left}}__TOC__

==Walkthrough==
[[File:Monk (2021 Halloween event) chathead.png|left]]
Speak to the [[Monk (2021 Halloween event)|protesting monk]]s in [[Varrock Square]]. They will ask you to go to the [[Edgeville Monastery]] and talk to [[Brother Jered]] as [[Oziach]] is trying to buy the whole monastery from them. After talking to Brother Jered on the {{FloorNumber|uk=0}} a cutscene will ensue with the player attempting to spook Oziach by making a scary noise with [[Jered's empty wine bottle]], while hiding inside a tree. Finish the dialogue and quickly climb into the tree. Return to Brother Jered and speak to him once more. He gives you an [[ad coupon]] to put an ad in the [[Varrock Herald]] to find a ghost accomplice.
[[File:2021 Halloween event - Scaring Oziach.png|right|thumb|One ghost was not enough!]]

Talk to [[Benny]] in Varrock Square about the Halloween event and offer any of the three options.

[[File:2021 Halloween event - Death after the job.png|thumb|[[Death (NPC)|Death]] appears in the Blue Moon Inn, interested in the advertised job.]]
Go to the [[Blue Moon Inn]] to see if anyone responded to your advert. Talk to [[Iffie]]. A cutscene will follow afterwards with the player telling Iffie what to do for the job, with [[Death (NPC)|Death]] himself intervening and telling the player that he also wants the job. The player selects Iffie as their accomplice at the end. Talk to Iffie once more, then talk to the bartender and select the pie option. In the next cutscene select any pie insult to distract the cook so Iffie can steal some of the kitchen's utensils.

Head south of the monastery, where you will find Iffie. Speak to her to enter a cutscene where you and her chase Oziach away by climbing trees and acting like ghosts. You must climb the three trees with a 'climb' option without being spotted by Oziach, or the cutscene will restart.

Speak to Iffie after the cutscene, after answering yes to provide her with her reward, you return to the Blue Moon Inn in Varrock for another cutscene. Once it completes, finish the dialogue to finish the event.

Congratulations, event complete!

==Rewards==
[[File:2021 Halloween party.png|thumb|Partying in the Blue Moon Inn.]]
* [[Haunted wine bottle]]
* [[Saucepan]]
* [[Ugly halloween jumper]]
* Two noted [[pumpkin]]s
* Two noted [[Halloween mask set]]s
* Rewards from previous events, which can be claimed from [[Diango]].
* [[Spooky]], [[Dead Can Dance]] and [[Illusive]] music tracks are unlocked in the cutscenes, without requiring the player to go to their usual unlock locations.

==Transcript==
{{Hastranscript|event}}

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}
{{Subject changes
|daterange = 20-30 October 2021
|change = Two typos were fixed in Oziach's overhead dialogue in a cutscene.<!--i'm[sic] off. You can keep the monastary[sic]!-->
}}
{{Subject changes footer}}

==Trivia==
* There are numerous references to previously released quests throughout the event, including (but not limited to) [[Recipe for Disaster]] and [[Monk's Friend]]. Completing certain quests will give the player new options to insult the cook's pumpkin pie that the player can reference.
** [[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing King Awowogei|Freeing King Awowogei]] in [[Recipe for Disaster]]: "Urgh, I'd rather eat a [[stuffed snake]] with [[Awowogei]] than this!"
** [[The Lost Tribe]]: "Blerg, I think I'd rather eat some [[H.A.M. robes]] than this!"
** [[Cook's Assistant]]: "I may only be a cooks assistant, but this food is terrible!"
** Other options: "Yuck, even a [[stray dog]] wouldn't eat this!", "This tastes eww, urgh, blerg, yuck!"
* The music tracks [[Getting Down to Business]] and [[Illusive]] play during cutscenes in the event, allowing free-to-play players to unlock these previously members-only tracks. This also allows Illusive to be unlocked without completing [[Dream Mentor]].
* During the event, after you recruited Iffie, an empty [[Rocking chair (2021 Halloween event)|rocking chair]] is shown in the shop, still rocking. Examining it reveals the text "Where did Iffie go? And who is rocking the chair?!?"
* If players attempt to use any items on the climbable evergreen<!-- (ID: 42874) --> tree, the chatbox will state <q>''I don't want to do that to this tree!''</q> This includes [[raw herring]]s and cooked [[herring]]s.<!-- The climbable evergreen (ID: 42873) in the instance states: "Nothing interesting happens." -->
* The '''LFG''' advert is a reference to an acronym used by players of multiplayer games looking for a group.

===Bugs===
{{Bug|In the cinematic action scene south of the [[Edgeville Monastery]] where the player and [[Iffie (2021 Halloween event)|Iffie]] both desire to climb the trees to scare Oziach, if the player attempts to climb the evergreen trees on Iffie's side or too far down the path, Oziach cannot spot the player anymore. Leaving the instance or climbing the next ''correct'' tree resolves this.}}
{{Bug|Once Iffie has returned to [[Thessalia's Fine Clothes.]] store, if Iffie attempted to give the player their rewards<!--Varbit 13097 == 109 --> but the player didn't have enough free inventory space, and the player then chooses to say they're not ready for the rewards, Iffie's dialogue abruptly continues to her being busy knitting:<ref group="note">Before the player's had a chat with Iffie first,<!--Varbit 13097 == 108 --> her dialogue ends as intended:
* Not yet.
** '''Player:''' Not yet.
** '''Iffie:''' Come back when you are, I have something for you!
** {{tact|end}}
After the player has claimed the rewards,<!--Varbit 13097 == 110 --> she no longer talks about the Halloween event as intended, reverting back to her one-liner non-event dialogue:
* '''Iffie:''' Sorry, dearie, if I stop to chat I'll lose count.
* {{tact|end}}
</ref>
* '''Iffie:''' Hello [player name]! Are you ready for your rewards now?
** Yes!
*** {{tact|Dialogue}}
*** {{tact|end}}
** Not yet.
*** '''Player:''' Not yet.
*** '''Iffie:''' Come back when you are, I have something for you!
*** {{tact|continue}}{{sic}}
* '''Iffie:''' Sorry, dearie, if I stop to chat I'll lose count.
* {{tact|end}}}}
